poem:
Title: "Upon the Verdant Campus"

The red wheelbarrow of discourse,
spattered with the rain of salvos,
leans against the white protest of intellect.
Simmering is the tapestry of ethereal truth,
while prejudice, a headache of crows,
caws on the twilight of equality.
Oh, not antisemitism, but the rightwing's plan,
how it fills up the plates with partition.
Beware, for democracy's life is in the feathers.
